Reviews.Title: Nice Video, OK Audio, But it Crashes
Reviews.Author: huntandpeck
Reviews.Content: Wanted a bedroom TV that had full 1080p, network interface and Yahoo! Widgets (or similar capabilities).  Most other TV manufacturers offer this combination of features only in models of 40 inches or larger -- I wanted a smaller size for a simple bedroom TV.First, the good things...  Very nice picture that remains clear and viewable even from way off angle -- this is its strongest feature.  Also, the built-in Yahoo! Widgets include being able to view movies or listen to music ordered from services such as Netflix and Pandora without an outboard box.  Further, one of the Widgets brings in TV Guide over the Internet, which is helpful if your cable company can't seem to successfully transmit a TV Guide (or similar function) over their own cable.  I also found the remote control to actually be pretty good in the sense that the different buttons are of different shapes and sizes that you can actually find the correct buttons to push by touch without looking at them.Second, the OK thing...  I have to echo, to some extent, some of the other reviews that criticize the audio -- it's not really that bad, but I've had other LCD TVs of similar size that did better.  I must say, though, that the audio is clear, so you won't find yourself unable to understand what someone is saying when they're speaking softly, and the speakers output a full enough range that you won't find yourself wondering where an instrument disappeared to when listening to a piece of music.  I have encountered other small TVs (both old CRT types and current-day LCD types) that have had audio far, far worse than this -- some were so bad that the whole casing of the TV would vibrate when certain instruments were played in a piece of music -- this TV definitely does not have anything like that problem.Third, the problem...  It actually crashes!  This has to be the weirdest thing I've ever experienced or have ever said about a TV, but this thing actually crashes to the extent that it completely ignores the remote and its built-in button controls, and can only be brought back under control by unplugging it!  I'm guessing, but I think it's a simple case of overheating, because the crashes occur after it's been on for a number of hours to the point where the back side feels awfully hot.  The heat is a little surprising, since this is an edge-lit LED TV, and not one that uses CCFL backlighting.  Also, it doesn't seem to matter whether you use any of the Widget applications, or not -- the crashing occurs even when you do nothing more than feed it video from a cable box or other source.  So, the crashing doesn't seem to be precipitated by running any particular Widget application.Fourth, some missing information...  It is not made clear on Vizio's website or even if you download a PDF of the user's manual, but this TV comes with an external brick-type power supply.  This item caught me by surprise as most LCD TVs of this size (in my experience) have the power supply built in.  This is not a big deal, unless you intend to wall-mount it, in which case, you'll need to decide what to do with the brick power supply.All-in-all, I would be perfectly happy with this TV if I didn't occasionally need to unplug it in order to bring it back from crashing.  It's this weird crashing behavior that is actually causing me to consider returning it.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful TV but sound could be better
Reviews.Author: UGrev
Reviews.Content: Let me preface my review with the following. I'm not an audiophile and this purchase was made for a bedroom TV.The picture quality is fantastic; and by fantastic, I mean better than my 42in Samsung Plasma.  The sound is less "tinny" than the previous model, but it still lacks in the bass which gives it that Laptop Speaker sound quality; though at a moderate volume, the quality appears to sound better (at least to me); Otherwise, for a bedroom TV, it's superb.WiFi is easy to set up (built in, and supported 128bit encryption). I found the settings/menu system to be extremely well done and easy to use with their remote control.Tried netflix and with only 2 bars for WiFi (due to distance from router), the picture quality was awesome and never "readjusted" due to signal degradation.The controls are located on the back of the TV, which makes it little cumbersome for the fly by power on, but I like it because my 3 year old likes to push buttons. Besides...we have remotes, right?The remote is a little cheap, but easy to use.Vizio apps load fast on my network (ymmv).-.5 for not so good bass (or lack there of at low vol)-.5 for lack of more possible sound options in the menu.You're definitely paying for picture, built in wifi & internet apps over sound quality with this purchase, so if you if you go into this purchase knowing this (as I did), then you should be happy and you could always hook up some external speakers to boost the sound quality.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: We bought this to replace the 19" LCD that was in our kitchen and we absolutely love it.  It was easy to connect to the internet (although I am good with computers and electronics).  The picture we get when streaming netflix is awesome.  Everyone that has been over comments on how thin the TV is and what a great picture it has.Other reviewers have commented on poor audio quality, I don't agree with them.  I guess there is room for improvement as far as the speakers go, but do you people really expect home theater sound out of a $400 high def razor thin TV?  Also the TV is in my kitchen where there is usually so much background noise and other stuff going on that the quality of the sound isn't really an issue. Lastly no one who has come over has ever made a comment on the sound quality and these are friends, not visitors who are trying to be polite.The internet apps all work great and entertain the kids for hours (I just need to figure out how to block the less appropriate content and it would be perfect).  I would buy this TV again in a heartbeat.Edit on 12/18/2010: We have used this TV everyday for the past two months and we still love it.  Pandora is great for Christmas music while we decorate and wrap presents. The internet apps work great and still no comments (good ones or bad ones) on the sound quality. We are still very happy with our purchase and I would definitely buy this TV again.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Picture, External Speakers w/ Optical connection a MUST
Reviews.Author: arizonastate
Reviews.Content: I purchased the VIZIO M261VP for the bedroom.  The following key specs attracted me to this TV:  LED backlight HDTV, 1080p resolution, built-in WiFi with 802.11n, and Netflix streaming. I had read the dozen or so reviews on this TV before my purchase knowing the picture quality would be excellent but the audio would be sub par.  I knew that I would need to hook up external stereo speakers based on all the negative audio reviews.I made the purchase in mid December after this TV went on sale at Sam's Club for $289.  The price on this TV will regularly go on sale at Office Max or Sam's Club for less than $300.00.  Even if you need to drop $40.00 on a Sam's Club membership, which I did, it is still a bargain.I have been using this TV for a week now.  The picture quality is EXCELLENT and I am very satisfied.  However, the audio quality is as bad as every negative review out there.  It is well known the smaller flat panel HDTV's on the market today have poor sound quality.  But, the VIZIO M261VP takes it to a new low.  The sound quality is hysterically horrible.  I found there were no audio setting adjustments to the SRS TruSurround and/or SRS TruVolume that improved the sound quality.  Do not buy this TV without knowing, which I did, you will need external speakers (even if it is for use in a bedroom or kitchen).There are only two ways to connect external speakers on this TV: through the headphone jack or through the digital optical connection.  Unfortunately, standard RCA audio output jacks are not included on this TV which is what most stereo and home theatre systems use.  To improve the sound quality, I first hooked up an old pair of Altec computer speakers and subwoofer using the headphone jack connection on the TV.  The computer speakers actually produced very good stereo sound quality that would be acceptable for regular TV viewing for most people.  But, if you plan to stream movies from the internet, it is important to know the sound will not come through the headphone jack to your external speakers.  The audio output signal from streaming is a digital signal and this signal cannot be transferred through the analog headphone jack.  No sound will come out to the external speakers.  The TV speakers of course will work, but the sound quality will be very poor on this TV.Instead of using the headphone jack connection, I recommend hooking up external speakers - a soundbar, or a home theatre system that have an optical digital connection.  I ditched the Altec computer speakers and purchased the ZVOX 550HSD sound bar system (28" width) from ZVOX Audio.  It uses an optical digital TOSLINK cable to connect the soundbar to the TV.  The sound quality is amazing...Wow!  I now have incredible sound to match the awesome picture.  The Netflix and Amazon Movie streaming quality and experience on this TV have been excellent!!Bottom Line:  I recommend the VIZIO M261VP 1080p HDTV due to its price, features, and amazing picture quality.  However, due to the very poor audio quality, external speakers of some kind (soundbar, home theatre system) with an optical digital connection is a MUST.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the $
Reviews.Author: Ed Sku "Edge3333"
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is excellent.  The stand is flimsy...required a little shim added to the base before screwing it in to get the set level.  I suspect that those reviewers that have complained about the sound quality haven't properly used the available adjustments.  Try this:1. Menu2. Audio3. Audio Mode...Flat4. SRS TRuSurround HD...Off5. Equalizer Settings6. Audio Mode...Flat7. EQ Mode...Basic8. Bass..increase to 20The sound will be just fine.I highly recommend this TV.  It's not a Sony, but then, you're not paying Sony prices,

Reviews.Title: Great 26" TV
Reviews.Author: geemaniac
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV since August and have been perfectly satisfied - until last night, when it would not respond to any command, either from the remote or back side buttons, even after unplugging/replugging the set. I called tech support and was pleasantly surprised to be connected to a very knowledgeable gent located in So. Dakota! He had me back in business in no time. (For those interested, the fix is to unplug the TV, hold the on/off button in for at least 30 secs, then plug it back in). The most painless TS call ever! Thanks Vizio for keeping things local.As for the TV itself, I couldn't be happier. Outstanding picture, can't complain about the sound, but I never turn it up past 25 on their volume scale. If you're not happy with the sound, and you don't adjust it much, you can remedy the problem with some computer speakers plugged into the headphone jack. Connection to my network went flawlessly. The widgets that I've tried work well (Netflix streaming, FaceBook and a couple of others) as Yahoo! adds more, they are displayed on the app screen as new and you have the option of adding them or not. The various picture modes are explained well, unlike some other TVs manuals. Actually, the whole manual is well written and informative, with the exception of where the power line plugs into the set. The LED back lighting is adjustable.A couple of things could be an issue for some. As mentioned, the 'brick' power supply, along with the side mounted cables. This could be problematic for those wanting a clean wall mount. Also the lack of a functional USB port.If you're in the market for an ultra-thin smaller screen internet capable TV, this merits serious consideration.

Reviews.Title: Good TV - Lower Price elsewhere
Reviews.Author: FLPilgrim
Reviews.Content: Just bought the TV, and it is working great so far. Easy to connect to wireless. I found this at Office Max for less ($299) as listed in previous review. I also found (and purchased) it at Costco for $289.

Reviews.Title: Spectacular TV except for sound and disabled USB Port
Reviews.Author: blank "blank"
Reviews.Content: Vizio M261VP. I guess you really can't have it all, can you? This TV has a really gorgeous picture (no kidding!) and the wi-fi functionality is awesome for streaming Netflix. Bloody fantastic.The sound, however, is really tinny, so much so it is like listening to a soup can on a string.Also, Vizio advertises an USB port on the box, but this port is actually disabled, except for Vizio service purposes. Why pimp it on the package if it is not active?I won't bore you with my extensive search for better sound and USB input/output, but this is the only worthwhile solution really, to supply the missing electronics:Philips HTS3371D/372D $99.00. This is routed in my house through a cable TV box via HDMI cable. The unit came with optical cable to export from the Vizio, though.The only output from the TV is an optical-cable sound connection, and mini-stereo jack for headphones. All other jacks are inputs (only) to the TV.Vizio did a great job with the picture. I'd like to see all the Philips sound/multimedia functionality in the same unit as the TV.

Reviews.Title: Lower Price
Reviews.Author: tom f beltrame
Reviews.Content: I bought this item at Office Max for $ 299 this weekend  .  Just got reduced Sunday  ,  I'm not sure why Amazon dosn't lower there price ?  The tv is great .

Reviews.Title: Remote Control Sucks
Reviews.Author: Saif
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV (M261VP) during this Thanks Giving sale. The TV is great but my only complaint is the remote (remote model # VR17). Since VIZIO calls this an Internet TV, there is NO keyboard that slides as advertised. It even mentions in the manual that you can slide open for the keyboard. After nearly 3 frustrating hours, reseaching just to open the keyboard, I finally called Tech Support today. At first the lady said all Vizio Internet Apps (VIA) TV comes with the keyboard option. But after doing some research herself, she said that VR17 does not have that option - A BIG DISSAPONITMENT !!!.She said I could purchase VUR10 remote and that would cost me another $60. She suggested that I can buy a keyboard (yes, computer keyboard) instead. But when I asked her how I would connect to the TV, she had no clue.If there is a Vizio rep reading this review, please confirm this!!!

Reviews.Title: OK
Reviews.Author: dcanjam "dcanjam"
Reviews.Content: I will not complain for the price I paid.First, the good is the picture along with the apps. Vizio has already added more since I bought it last 2 months ago. I wanted a TV that I could use without having to bother my TV provider to get an additional setup for it and in turn pay for service to another TV. So with an antenna and internet connectivity, this gets the job done.The bad is that some of the apps do not always work well or at all and the sound. Netflix has always worked great for me, same is the case with Amazon Video. Those are the ones I want to work the most. So, no real complaints there. I wish it had Youtube, but oh well.As for the sound, I knew of the complaints that many spoke of. But, I figured I could just hook up my computer speakers with its sub and I'm good. But, that's not the case. This TV's external sound system really only works good through the digital toslink output. With analog, you can only attach via the headphone jack. Yes, it is an improvement, but, it would not push the subwoofer. Additionally, some apps sounded even worse. Others, sounded ok, Like Hulu and Amazon. Netflix was iffy. If you want to use the music apps, like Tunein radio, Rhapsody or Pandora, forget it. I hated that I could not utilize the power of the sub, knowing that I had premium computer speakers. That really irritated me because I wasn't planning on buying a sound system for this TV. Almost any optical input speaker system is fairly expensive. I almost switched this for a smaller Sony Bravia with Internet video. I knew the sound would be good on it and that I could fully utilize my computer speakers if I wanted more sound. But, I ended up finding a used Vizio sound bar in great condition for really cheap on Craigslist. So, I am keeping it for now. It's kind of a shame that external system is almost essential for any smaller Vizios. But, now I can truly amplify the sound like I want to. It works well for all the apps as well.I would only recommend this TV if you were planning on connecting to a sound system that has an optical input.

Reviews.Title: A possible M261VP audio (bass problem) fix
Reviews.Author: DerkMan
Reviews.Content: I think i was able to fix that horrible audio problem that causes a lack of bass on the m261vp.  Upon first turning on the TV enter the network screen and connect to a network.  Skip the channel search before loading up any channels, while the screen is still black, change the advanced audio settings to SRS trusurround HD = off, SRS truvolume = off, Digital Audio Out = Dolby Digital.  Then go into equalizer settings change audio mode = flat, EQ mode = basic.  And finally turn the base all the way up to 24.  If you turn any of the audio settings like srstrusurround back on, and you try to go back it will not work and will continue to get that tinny audio sound.  I was able to repeat this after screwing it up by resetting to the factory settings and repeating the process.  Hopefully this fix works for everyone because this audio problem essentially turns this TV from a 5 star purchase to 1 star.  But with this audio fix, this is one the best cheapest TV's I've ever used.  Best of Luck!

Reviews.Title: How not to use this TV
Reviews.Author: Louis W.
Reviews.Content: Don't expect to get better sound by plugging in speakers to the headphones jack. There was a firmware update that pretty much killed that port. It works, but it sounds terrible. The sound used to be fine on both the built in speakers and by plugging in headphones or speakers. Not anymore.It's great as a PC monitor for gaming and watching movies, the viewing angles are fantastic! But the pixel pitch is too large for any reading. Also, about text, there is a problem with subpixel rendering that the TV does on its own. It sometimes interferes with subpixel rendering done by the operating system, for example ClearType on Windows. The problem is obvious with red text on black, but noticeable with many other color combinations.Since the sound is terrible, and it's not suitable as a PC monitor, the only scenario that this TV would be a great fit for is as a dedicated HTPC monitor in a very small space. I don't see how it can be viable as a TV with the awful sound that can't be corrected.

Reviews.Title: Really bad sound
Reviews.Author: Horndawg54
Reviews.Content: I owned this TV for 1 day.  Using HDMI cables the picture was very good.  The sound was incredibly tinny, no bass what so ever.  Back it went.  I know i could have ordered another speaker system, but for a kitchen TV I shouldn't have to.  It should have benn better than it was.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: J. Jarrett
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV now for a week and really like it.Pros:1. The picture is great with a very wide veiwing angle.2. The wireless functionality works great as well.  I can easily stream video which was one of the main reasons I picked this TV.  I am a member of Amazon Prime and wanted any new TV I got to be able to take advanatage of their streaming service.3. Very light and sturdy on its stand.I don't want to say Cons for my next list because these issues are not that bad but I wanted you to be aware.1. The sound.  I read a lot of complaints about the sound and that was the main thing I was afraid of when I got it.  But really it isnt bad.  There is not a lot of bass.  But that seems to make sense to me.  It is such a thin light monitor why would someone expect it to sound like a theater.  That said about the bass - the sound is good.  Can I tell the difference in sound when I am in my living room and then go to my bedroom to watch this?  Yes.  But the sound is still fine.  It seems silly that so many people have complained about it.2. The power cable.  I am not sure how you would hang this TV on a wall.  The power cable has a brick attached to it.  To save room on the TV and I assume make it less heavy and hot they put the power converter separate from the TV.  About halfway down the power cable is a box about half the size of a brick.  If you have room for the brick it is a non issue.I am very happy with my purchase.  It is my first Vizio as I had been a Sony only person before.  I will not hesitate to purchase a Vizio in the future.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good, but has a few issues
Reviews.Author: R. David Berg
Reviews.Content: Overall happy about this tv. Here is my summary:ProsGreat pictureSlim profileApps work pretty well such as netflix and pandoraMenus pretty easy to useWifi is goodConsSound hack required to get it working right, still not that greatNo streaming media from computers on the networkDoes not support NTFS external drivesRemote control feels cheap and buttons require hard pressingApp interfaces can feel a bit laggyChanging channels is way to slowDespite the cons, I still like it. Think a roku box and a no app cheaper LED LCD tv might be a better overall solution though.

Reviews.Title: Very Impressive
Reviews.Author: SSKathleen "Kathy"
Reviews.Content: The only negative I have is the horrible sound these 5-watt speakers produce. Even adjusting the equalizer doesn't help. However I have ordered (from Amazon) the "ZVOX 525 Low-Profile Single-Cabinet Surround Sound System" which should work perfectly.The TV has a fabulous quality in the picture and makes me wish I had purchased a Vizio for my living room too, rather than the 37" Polaroid that I got a few years back.I didn't purchase this TV because of the Internet Apps, etc. but at some time down the road, will probably look into using it. I have a dual-band N router, wi-fi, laptop, desktop, iPad2 and iPhone 4 in my bedroom, so it would be "computer central" for sure!My Mother is hearing impaired and this remote provides Closed Captioning when she views my TV with the push of one button. Nice feature for us.I am 65+ and was able to lift into the armoire with ease and install to my digital cable box. I have a VCR that runs through the cable box and someday will probably invest in a blue-ray player.I run my bedroom TV 24/7, so I am praying it lasts longer than the 27" Olevia HDTV that recently burned out after only 2 years.In conclusion, you can't beat the price for such quality - but just know in advance - the sound is horrible.

Reviews.Title: Could NOT ask for better!
Reviews.Author: Kelley Chambers
Reviews.Content: Like most other people, I wanted a 26" LED powered, internet ready TV for my bedroom.  Didn't want to hook up a computer for it and try to remember to power off the computer AND the monitor after Netflix finished streaming my video while I snored for hours straight through it. :)  Yeah, not the ideal setup. So, as a result, this Vizio M261VP is EXACTLY what the doctor ordered.  I see some folks below complaining about the audio quality. Yeah, ok the bass is lacking, but look... it's an HDTV/monitor with BUILT-IN WIFI... it's NOT supposed to be a surround sound, kick ass, home theatre audio system!  Gimme a break... if you're using this in your bedroom like I am, you're NOT going to miss the lack of bass... you just aren't!  If you're one of the very few using it in your bedroom and DO miss it, it's a simple fix.  Hook some usb speakers to it... easy peezy, lemon squeezy.  And if you're THAT old school, use regular computer speakers with the RCA jacks...  *rolling eyes*Didn't buy it through Amazon but did buy it through eBay because I found a refurb deal that was $100 bucks less than the lowest used price on Amazon.  Always come to Amazon first... and most times they rock the casbah with price and shipping.. especially since I'm a prime member... but this time, it wasn't in the cards.  That said, I'm THROUGHLY satisfied with this impeccably THIN, 1080p, INTERNET READY WITH NETFLIX BUILT IN!!!, 26" TV/Monitor that just oozes STELLAR video quality... oh yeah, I'm in love... oh wait... maybe that's techno lust! :)

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE SOUND & AUDIO OUT
Reviews.Author: Rod
Reviews.Content: The picture is awesome and pristine, but what is the point without audio options? The speaker is terrible, which is to be expected, but the audio output options are limited to a headphone jack and optical audio. This would of been ok, as I have great speakers that can be plugged in through the headphone port, but there seems to be no internal amplification unit built in so it sounds exactly the same coming out of my top of the line speakers as it does the built in one. Very disappointing. If you don't care about sound whatsoever then go for it, but seems utterly pointless to have such things as netflix and pandora running without quality audio.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO 26" IS GREAT!
Reviews.Author: R. Coghill "mixed metaphor"
Reviews.Content: Nearly the only complaint I see from others regards speaker quality. I don't know what these people expect from a thin 26" set. Adding better speakers is a pretty straightforward process (rca audio plugs and cable are included)...well worth it if you love sound quality. We have it in a spare bedroom, and we both really like it. Picture quality is really good from nearly every angle. Weight is minimal. Set-up was really easy...even the wireless part. One of my favorite features is the remote. This is my forth flat screen and by far this remote is the best made and incredibly logical. To get to wireless (mainly Netflix) for us requires only a large button near the center of the remote and thumb button navigation. The input button at the top of the remote enables you to navigate anywhere else you have set-up. My wife loves it and she is not a techie, but loves Netflix. If you are looking for a 26" set, this is a great pick. I couldn't find a more satisfying purchase. Thanks Vizio!

Reviews.Title: quick shipping
Reviews.Author: Katherine J. Cihak "k.cihak"
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed on the speed of shipping! Not that that has anything to do with the TV itself, but rather the seller.I haven't had the TV for long so I'm still trying to figure it all out. But so far, the picture is really good, the audio isn't nearly as bad as I was expecting but we'll see on that one. Netflix works really well! So overall I'm extremely pleased with the purchase!I'd recommend this TV to anyone who wants a bathroom/kitchen/or bedroom TV!!Edit:1/14/12I've had this TV for a few months now so I feel it's appropriate to update my review. I never thought the sound was bad, however my boyfriend purchased me a sound bar which he says makes the sound about 75x's better. (I don't really hear that big of a difference except on local channels). The picture quality is amazing and the Netflix app is convenient, only thing I don't like about it is that it doesn't save the shows i've watched or the place I left off on, so I have to scroll pretty often.I'm still extremely pleased with my TV!highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture but poor audio and bad quirks - Still a great purchase
Reviews.Author: Wade Burchette
Reviews.Content: First the good, the picture quality is great. It is easy on the eyes in any light condition. Some TV's are hard on my eyes in low light. 3D movies are murder on my eyes in the theater. This TV doesn't hurt my eyes. The reason why I bought a HDTV with an LED backlight is, not for the energy savings or the size, but because LED backlights are easier on the eyes than traditional florescent backlights. The blacks of the TV are black. I consider the picture quality to be the most important part of the HDTV and this does not disappoint. The TV scales SD images well. Even watching SD movies in Netflix look good.The Vizio internet apps is an excellent bonus. It has the essential Netflix, which works well. I haven't yet tried to get a HD movie through my Wi-Fi with Netflix. I may end up running an ethernet cable to it instead of using Wi-Fi. I quickly found an app from my local TV station which I installed. Now I can get the radar on my TV anytime! There are plenty of apps to download, including many useless ones you just know Vizio was paid to install by default. Unfortunately you cannot (yet) get a Youtube app.Now some bad. The audio is just terrible. No bass, very high pitched. I plan on using some small external speakers to deal with the bad sound. This is an annoyance but not a turn-off. This problem can easily be addressed.If you want to do some channel surfing with your cable or over the air TV you better be prepared to spend some time doing so. It takes about 1.5 seconds for the TV to change channels, even the old analog channels. This problem can also be fixed with a DVR, satellite or cable box, or media center PC.As far as the extras: Switching between apps is slow because Vizio thought the effect of scrolling to the next app was better than my time. Not too big of a deal since I won't be using many apps to begin with. The Wi-Fi antenna is a little weak. It only gets a medium strength signal even though my router is about 20 feet away. When the TV was first set up, it asked for my name, phone number, and email. I didn't provide my phone or email, that is none of Vizio's business.Overall I am very happy with this TV. It makes a great TV for the bedroom. I have no regrets. My recommendation is save up a little extra money and get some external speakers at the same time.

Reviews.Title: DEFECTIVE AUDIO PROCESSING
Reviews.Author: AUDIO/VIDEO HOBBIEST
Reviews.Content: No, it's not because it's a small tv with small speakers.  The audio processing is flawed in that it does not allow any frequency below approx. 1000 cycles to pass to the tv speakers or through the mini plug headphone outlet.  Full range sound is discernable for an instant when you attempt to adjust equalization or change channels.  You will not be able to bypass this problem via external speakers if you use the headphone outlet.  Your only recourse is to use the digital optical output.There are numerous complaints of a similar nature on both the Amazon & Vizio websites, yet Vizio customer service refuses to admit a problem exists.  Their phone reps are technologically illiterate.  This is the worst customer service I've encountered with an electronics product.PS - No complaints on video performance but the tv is unwatchable with the audio problem.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: JT
Reviews.Content: I Really am impressed by the T.V. quality. For the price it is a deal, internet apps work flawlessly, the built in wifi is great and the picture quality is superb. The quality of the T.V. makes it feel much larger than a typical 26". The audio lacks a range, limited on the bass sounds but it is on par with most speakers on flat panel t.v.'s. Also impressed with how thin it is, looks great on the wall!

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: Lina
Reviews.Content: This is a great size for the bedroom! I've had this TV for a few weeks and so far I have been very pleased with it.I've read a lot of reviews from amazon, walmart, costco, etc. regarding this TV and most of the reviews are complaining about the sound quality. Well, I'm not an audiophile person so to me the sound quality is pretty good. Yes, there is a bit of a difference in terms of sound quality, but nothing crucial.I read that one user said that the TV overheats? It doesn't happen to mine. I usually go to bed with the TV on and it stays on for the entire night til morning (12 hours or more). The TV or the AC power doesn't heat up. Maybe a tinyyyy bit warm, but that's it.I also stream Netflix on this device and it's excellent. I still haven't figure out to turn on the subtitle on some of the Netflix instant watch... or maybe there you can't do it on this TV. Anyway, I'm really glad with this purchase. I would buy it again if I need one.

Reviews.Title: It's a TV, not a PC
Reviews.Author: Charles R Garner
Reviews.Content: Don't buy this expecting to get any real use out of the internet options unless you just live for facebook/twitter.  No real browser function, and half the yahoo widgets don't work in the VIA interface.The TV quality is great for the price, and just as good, if not better than any other HDTV in my house.  The tuner is relatively slow changing channels, which makes channel surfing obnoxious-  it has an integrated TV guide widget that pulls from the internet, but is almost useless as it doesn't change the channel for you when you DO find something, which is a big oversight.The remote has no visibility in the dark, so unless you memorize every minor button, it's difficult to use the VIA / web interface in the dark.I would get this if you use streaming netflix or amazon video, otherwise, if you just need an HDTV, you'll find the internet interface more of a neusance than a feature.  If they came out with a browser and some REAL free streaming content for it, it would be great.Hulu, CBS, NBC, ABC, etc isn't streaming on this device, so don't buy it planning to cancel your cable, either.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, Lousy sound, If you have a Router passcode issue...
Reviews.Author: SDM120
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to bore you repeating what everyone else has said. They're right, great picture, tinny sound. It's a second TV for when I want to watch the ballgame, so I'll live with it. I own a 42" Vizio that's 18 months old and I love it, but I'm really disappointed in Vizio now.Technical note: You may have an issue connecting to your wireless router if you use a complicated WPA/WPA2 passphrase. This TV won't connect if you use spaces or mixed characters! After struggling to get this to connect and 2 calls to support, my case was escalated to second level support. They told me it only works with simple passphrases and suggested I use my phone number! DO NOT DO WHAT VIZIO TECH SUPPORT SAYS!!! A weak passphrase is an invitation to war drivers to hack your network. Use a long phrase without spaces. The worst part was having to change my 11 other wireless devices to match! Hopefully, Vizio will fix this in a firmware update.

Reviews.Title: A solid TV with some minor quarks
Reviews.Author: Donald Copeland "Bass Addict"
Reviews.Content: Assuming your TV arrives in proper working condition (there are always 1-star reviews because of defective units), you can expect a beautiful set with excellent picture quality and average sound quality. The set is very slim which probably explains why the power supply is external like a laptop (quark #1). I purchased this set to replace a 26" samsung (T260HD) and will say that picture quality is comparable but the Vizio has a much better vertical viewing angle; a potentially important attribute if this is destined for the bedroom. Many have complained about the sound quality and while I agree that it isn't great, I'd say it's typical for TVs in this size range. It is however irritating because if you are intending to watch movies and listen to music, you are literally missing a good chunk of frequencies on both ends of the spectrum and the result is a very dull, midrange emphasized sound...sort of like a record player (quark #2). I wasn't too concerned because I figured I could simply hook up some computer speakers via the headphone jack. HOWEVER, be forewarned that this audio output will sound as terrible as the TVs speakers, regardless of what speaker system you connect it to. I suspect the reason is because whatever capacitor/crossover network that regulates the frequencies going to the TVs speakers is also limiting the frequencies that go to the headphone audio output. The only solution is to use the optical audio output which unfortunately is far less common an input on any computer/compact speaker system. This is the only real issue I have with this set.As far as the internet capability goes, everything works pretty well. Occasionally, the scrolling will "twitch" like a smartphone (quark #3) but so far all the apps I've tested (Netflix, Yahoo, Pandora, Facebook, Hulu) all work without delay. Realistically though, it's far too time consuming to type extensively so you shouldn't plan on writing paragraph long responses on FB or the like. It's hard enough just to log in to your accounts! Overall, a competitive TV and definitely worth $300. It should be noted that this is the first non-Samsung TV I have owned since they took over the flat-panel HDTV market, so I would confidently say that Vizio has come up the ranks since they first started (unlike Westinghouse).

Reviews.Title: Good tv buts needs external speakers.
Reviews.Author: Tod Larson "bighead"
Reviews.Content: I love the picture and the ease of setting it up.  We had Netflix running in 5 minutes.However, the on board audio is very bad.  Very tinny... If that is a word.  We are buying a sound bar to go with it.

Reviews.Title: Vizio M261VP 26in Internet App TV
Reviews.Author: hfront
Reviews.Content: The Vizio M261VP is an excellent product. The picture quality is great.  The Internet Apps are better than any I have seen that comes with an Internet app blu-ray player.  It packs a lot into a 26 inch TV. This is great for kitchens, campers, and small work areas.  I wouldn't use it for a living room or family room be cause of the 26 inch size.  There was only one thing I didn't like about it, the remote control.  They should of had a pull out, small keyboard (the onscreen keyboard was terrible).

Reviews.Title: Great little tv
Reviews.Author: A Man
Reviews.Content: I got this from office max for 299. Its an awesome little TV with great video. 1080p on a screen this size is hard to find. I needed that just in case I decide to hook my pc up to it. I was scared that the audio would be horrible from what I heard from the other reviews but it is very adequate. I turned the surround sound option off and I think it sounds great. Anyone expecting excellent sound from a 26 inch LED for this price has to be insane. I am using this TV in my bedroom and it looks and sounds wonderful. If I need better sound then I can attach a sound bar to the digital out.  Its sucks that a USB is given but is locked. Maybe they will unlock it in some future update. I bought this TV primarily for Netflix and the available widgets. The widgets work great and netflix streams without a hitch. I connected to my home WIFI in seconds. The other Yahoo widgets work great. Pandora works just fine but I was worried that the screen will get burn in with the lack of screen saver. To the other reviewer who was looking for stellar sound for Pandora: Unless you have subscribed to Pandora the sound is not high quality anyway. If you are a subscriber then u would be better off with running the sound through a receiver.  :)  Buy it, you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, but on-board sound poor
Reviews.Author: J. T.
Reviews.Content: Bought this because of the internet connectivity (Netflix, Pandora, ....)Picture is GREAT, not much more to add to that.Speakers on the TV are poor.  However, I am finding the optical sound output with my 5.1 surround sound system gives great thundering base and makes internet music fun to listen to.I have had connectivity issues with the wifi.  In fact with 8 routers in my neighborhood, it can't find any of them.  Didn't investigate solutions as I had a wired connection nearby.A bit surprised to see my TV totally lock up with during problems with some of apps.  However, this TV fuses some third party (yahoo) widgets with the TV for its internet capabilities and lock ups are part of early versions of software/firmware.A minor point, but the channel changing is very slow.In summary- for my needs, the TV works fine.  I wouldn't say it works as well as it should.  Non-technical users (and channel flippers) may want to avoid this generation of Vizio firmware.

Reviews.Title: This one is going back - no excuse is good enough- read on...
Reviews.Author: M. Barrett "just another consumer"
Reviews.Content: Here is a transcript from my "chat" with Vizio today.Gil: Thank you for contacting VIZIO Live Chat, the home of Entertainment Freedom for All.  This is Gil in South Dakota. Have you ever contacted us before? M Barrett: no Gil: Ok and I understand you're concerned with the audio from your television? M Barrett: Apparently there is a known problem with the audio of the 26" M261 VP..  What is the fix?  Is there a firmware update? Gil: Here at VIZIO we pride ourselves in providing best in class customer support and all of our support is U.S. based, and I can assist you with that. There is no firmware update for the tv at this time. Have you tried adjusting the audio settings in the menu? M Barrett:Yes, I have.  It doesn't help.  I noticed one of the criticisms in reviews was that Vizio denies there is a problem.  I am telling you THERE IS.  Is there some auxilary fix to this?  running the audio thru a tuner amp?  I need to do something soon so I am not stuck with a lemon. Gil: We don't really have any workaround to improve the audio quality. I really am sorry if it does not meet your needs. The speakers on this model really are what they are. You may want to swap it out for another model if it's not what you need.M Barrett:Maybe I should, but another brand instead.  Gil - you didn't answer my last question which was about any auxilary workaround.  Why isn't Vizio doing something about this - you would think that Vizio would do something about it if they truly think they pride themselves on their products.M Barrett: Uh, Gil?  are you still there?Gil: Like I said about the workaround, we don't have anything specific we could suggest unfortunately. We understand that some people are not happy with the audio quality on the tv, it is a small tv but it has actually been discontinued. It's an older model and we offer many other models of that size that will likely meet your needs better.Gil: Not all of our smaller tv's have the best speakers in them, this was one that had lower end speakers put in to keep the price point down for those who wanted it Gil: We offer other models though that have better speakers.M Barrett:Thank you, Gil.  Based on these responses and Vizio's dismal record and failure to make good what is soooo bad I don't think I can consider ever buying another product from Vizio.  It isn't like this is the very first small TV I have bought.  I understand what you are saying, but they are really bad. Thank you for your time.Follow-up Aug 24thI bought the 26' Vizio m261vd and the sound was awful - almost brought it back for refund but gave it another chance and paid $100 for the sound bar. didn't work. bought optical cable. worked. could not program the TV remote that was described in the description by Walmart and Vizio as being a universal remote. It is not. Boxed up the stuff I purchased when I could get nowhere with tech support. made last ditch effort with tech support and next day during my lunchbreak found a Sony Google TV that is bigger and cheaper than all I have spent so far. Got back from lunch and I had an email that stated Vizio was sending me this remote. This is a "should I stay or should I go" type of moment. I do appreciate the fact that Vizio is stepping up to the plate on this. Even if it is because not to do so would mean they were in violation of federal DTPA laws. I appreciate it. It took me a week of hell to get this far.

Reviews.Title: No more Vizio for me !
Reviews.Author: S. Baker "Goat Rancher"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to put in the Den for the wife's home office. I spent a couple hundred dollars more because of the Vizio name, resolution, compact size etc. She spends a fair amount of time there so I opted for the more expensive choice. It is just past the year warranty and now it has no picture. I called tech service for Vizio and we went through some diagnostics. It turns out the back lighting function is no more. They said it could be repaired on my nickel. I opted not to do that as I live in a remote area and service technicians have to travel a great distance so the repair bill would be substantial. I politely told the tech service rep. the reason I bought their brand and I had spent more money than for the competitive brands. I told her this would be my first and last Vizio product. She offered nothing other than to say have a nice day and hung up. Things like this happen I am sure with other brands too, but I will take my chances. No more Vizio for me !!!!

Reviews.Title: This is/was a great tv while it lasted.......
Reviews.Author: Bryan C. Kelly
Reviews.Content: We have had this tv for 7.5 months and the wi-fi has was started to lock up the unit and force it to restart. Then there is the streaming issue of locking up ,lossing signal (even though it has full signal)that has only gotten worse the more we watch. I am in the proccess of trying to get a refund, what a drag cause the unit has a great picture and fit in the kitchen great!

Reviews.Title: Nice TV for 2nd room. Crisp Picture.
Reviews.Author: MOmmy "MOmmy"
Reviews.Content: In time delivery and product was received in good working condition. This TV has crisp, sharp display, volume is ok, not bad as it sounds from some other reviews. The only drawback I see is that this Internet TV doesn't have a Youtube app. After sufficient research, this was one of the few TV's in 27-inch range which had in-built WI-FI, but was disappointed to see that Vizio TV's don't have Youtube app. Other than that I am happy with everything else this TV offers.

Reviews.Title: Does not last.
Reviews.Author: gogogranny
Reviews.Content: I did not buy mine from Amazon but want to review it anyway.If you buy a Visio tv make sure you buy the extended warrentee. My tv has a beautiful picture. I have now owned the tv for 16 months. When I turn it on I get a blank blue screen. Then after a few minutes I get vertical stripes. After A half hour I get the picture. I sent Visio an email, they answered with suggestions for me to try and if that didn't work I could call the company and get more instructions. They gave me the same instruction. When it still didn't work She wanted to suggest repairmen in my area. In my opinion if I owned a company I would be ashamed to admit that my product would not last more than a year. This is discusting to spend this kind of money and not get a decent product.

Reviews.Title: A Really Good Internet TV, After a Shaky Start
Reviews.Author: George L. Johnson
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture quality and surprisingly good simulated surround sound from a 26" Internet TV. Interestingly, Vizio is the only brand I could find in a 26" model, with built-in wi-fi and Internet capabilities. When first setting it up, there was no picture, only the LED backlight, and auto setup would not run. I called Vizio and received marginal advice tips, none of which solved the problem. They offered to replace it. However, they later called back and said the warranty was void because it was not purchased from an authorized reseller ... the TV's history indicates it was purchased at a Sam's Club several months earlier, and I bought it from Cheap Prices Check It Out, through Amazon Marketplace. Cheap Prices has been very responsive in helping resolve the warranty situation. Anyway, I decided to try the oldest remedy for any electronic device problem, a gentle slap on the backside. Voila! The TV springs to life, auo setup takes over, and has worked perfectly ever since. I like Vizio's Internet display and operation a lot.

Reviews.Title: My First Vizio HDTV Purchase
Reviews.Author: David W. Morgan "David Morgan"
Reviews.Content: This is my first Vizio HDTV purchase. The reviews were good and the price was right. It was delivered earlier than expected which is always a bonus. Setup was very easy - menu driven. The picture is absolutely stunning! 1080p is definitely the way to go. The colors are deep and rich and the detail is crisp. I have had the HDTV actually lock up a couple of times - like a PC would lock up (no response from the HDTV or remote) - when using VIA (Vizio Internet Apps) but I am using a DSL connection and it's quite possibly the culprit and not the HDTV. I had to unplug the HDTV, wait 60 seconds, then plug it back in (in other words - reboot the HDTV). This has always cleared the issue and I'm quickly back in business. I read one review where the reviewer reported this problem but did not mention the type of internet connection he was using.All in all, this is an excellent HDTV. I highly recommend it to anyone needing a smaller HDTV due to space limitations.*I would have given a rating of 5 stars had I not had any issues with VIA. But again, it might not be the HDTV. Only time will tell.

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV
Reviews.Author: C. Hauge "Stinson Pilot"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a reconditioned model in August of 2011, and have been very pleased with it. The sound is good and it does streaming video as advertised. I had no trouble setting it up whatsoever. The unit has been working well all along. The remote has to be well aimed in order to hit the sensor but I got used to that. Overall quality of the unit appears to be very good.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO M261VP 26-Inch 1080p LED LCD HDTV, Black
Reviews.Author: JWCorbett
Reviews.Content: I purchased the VIZIO M261VP 26-Inch 1080p LED LCD HDTV, Black refurbed for my work out room. Best compared to a Sony, the picture really is amazing beating my 55" Samsung, 19" Polaroid and 32" Panasonic handily, in fact I went around to all my TV's and cooled the color temp on each after viewing this TV. The Via Apps over a secure N connection was a key selling point. Netflix is the updated UI and all works quite well. Sound is as you would expect from a small flat screen, OK at best.

Reviews.Title: piltrade is name for good business
Reviews.Author: Shaymore "Shay"
Reviews.Content: I like the speedy shipment and the TV is great. I bought this for my 5-year old and he loves everything about it. It is easy to operate, loads fast and is easily programmable for those who need to keep some channels locked from kids. This is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Good little tv
Reviews.Author: dm222
Reviews.Content: Just got this for my son's playroom.  We do not have a cable box hooked up in the room, but the internet allowed all his Netflix movies to run.  It is extremely light and picture quality is excellent.  However, the sound is not good, but I find this common for small LED tv's.  I am getting the Mohu TV antenna to see if I can pick up some local stations soon.  The Remote buttons are small so I gave that a 3.  No problems after a few weeks. overall a great buy.  I will now only buy wifi ready TV 's.  I know you can get a 32" LCD for the same price, but LED with internet apps is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: Good picture, two suggestions: channel changing & audio
Reviews.Author: Leo gal
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV as a refurb.  Great so far (about 3 weeks), in terms of picture quality and apps.  Picture mode is set to "movie" which has the most accurate colors, with slight tweaking.  I can't imagine using the other picture modes as the colors are way off even with adjustments.  Stick with movie, not as good as my plasma, but good.  Lots of available apps.  I mainly use Netflix, Hulu Plus, and Pandora.  Wifi connectivity is great - connected right away and has stayed connected.  Streaming has been excellent.Now for the 2 major negatives.  Channel changing takes f-o-r-e-v-e-r.  A workaround: try hitting the "OK" button on the remote.  This pulls up a menu of all the channels.  You can easily scroll to select the channel you want.  Much, much faster than using the channel buttons.  And now for the notorious audio.  I initially hooked up my computer speakers through the headphone jack on the TV.  A very, very slight improvement, but absolutely no bass, except during that very brief moment between changing channels that others mentioned.  Someone in another review said that the only way to improve sound is to use the digital optical/toslink out and this is absolutely correct.  There are few options available for speakers/soundbars with optical input.  It seems that only the pricey, high-end soundbars are rated well, so I looked instead for a 2.1 system.  Based on price and sound quality, here is the best option I could find: Edifier S330D.  These speakers make a HUGE difference.  I can actually stream Pandora now without cringing.  BTW, someone in another review mentioned a speaker system that cost around $400 which to me is totally unrealistic for a bedroom TV.  BUT, at least that person offered a suggestion.  Please, please, if you know of other options, POST!!  I literally spent hours searching and researching speakers.  If you've found a solution that will improve the terrible sound of this TV, please share a review to save others time. [lecture over!]

Reviews.Title: Good! Except sound.
Reviews.Author: William Serna
Reviews.Content: The TV is awesome, as you already know (because you searched it) the apps are wonderful. The problem with the TV is the sound. It seems like the TV is capping the lowest frequencies on purpose. During countless hours tweaking the audio settings I discovered something strange, while you move the bars in the EQ for about half a second the bass comes in. If you keep moving it you can hear the bass perfectly. So this doesn't seem to be a hardware problem, and something that may be fixable with a firmware update or similar. I've been exchanging emails with Vizio support, and even if they don't fix this I won't return the TV, it was a really good deal (Walmart for less than 300) and the PS3 has netflix anyway.

Reviews.Title: Great refurbished internet TV, so far
Reviews.Author: The Unknown Amazon
Reviews.Content: This TV arrived well packed in plain cardboard, no manual (easily found on internet).  TV looks new, picture is great, no problems with internet (Netflix) access via wireless router.  TV automatically downloaded updates.  No crashing.  Sound is a bit tinny, purchased Panasonic 5.1 sound system with optical digital input; hasn't arrived yet.  Easily wall-mounted with small, articulating arm.  Not main TV but used off and on for about 4 weeks now.  Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Love love love :)
Reviews.Author: Fitz
Reviews.Content: I ordered this tv almost 7 months ago and I absolutely love it. I use it in my bedroom and it's currently hooked up to an xbox, ps3 and wii, as well as hd cable. It's on almost all day every day and I've never had a problem with it overheating. The picture is the best I've ever seen on any tv and the internet apps are really simple and fun to use. I recommend this tv to everyone I talk to. You won't regret getting this tv. The only problem I have is that I have to supplement the sound with a soundbar and the remote advertised to come with it didn't. The remote it comes with IS NOT the sliding keyboard remote that's advertised in some places. It looks exactly the same, but with no keyboard. Otherwise, this is the best purchase I've ever made.

Reviews.Title: go VIZIO !
Reviews.Author: S. Bell
Reviews.Content: VIZIO M261VP 26-Inch 1080p LED LCD HDTV with VIZIO Internet Application, Black by Viziofor those locations where you want to view the set in say an8 foot radius, and a lot of bedrooms fit this distance, thisset is wonderful.need better speakers? optical out.the stand was mentioned as a bit less sturdy.once i fully screwed the parts together withthe included hardward, ours sat firmly onthe video center shelf. it seems fine.for a small format set, the feature list isvery complete and the picture is excellent.the setup did 'see' my wireless router withoutany coaxing from me, but since i favor a hardwiredline for intensive internet file transfers, the includedEthernet hard port will be the ticket in our place.they might add controls on the lower front of the panelbezel next time and a forward facing USB port.those would be handy.i'm very satisfied with this system.

Reviews.Title: I find the audio to be fine/expected
Reviews.Author: Micah
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to put in my 2 cents about the speakers.  For our bedroom I find the sound to be just fine.  If it were in my living room, I would want to use an external amplifier and speakers.  The sound does lack lower tones/body but it is fine for watching tv/movies in a more casual manner.  Wife and I have the volume at maybe 2 or 3 out of 10 (if it were measured in that way) so there is plenty of room to raise.  As another review most eloquently stated..."it won't melt your face" but you can watch tv and movies.Netflix app works fine though there was some sort of glitch where I had to reset all the apps and re-activate the Netflix device (tv) to get it back.  That was frustrating but it has been working well since.  It would be sweet if they offered/included a remote with a keyboard for searching content as hunting and pecking kind of sucks.  Standard def tv might be worse looking than our old square tv (I guess that is normal) but the HD programing is great.I think that it's cool to have a tv that can instantly have programing anywhere there is internet...all in one package.  Crossing my fingers that the tv lasts given the low price.

Reviews.Title: Super LED LCD TV May Just BE PERFECT TV
Reviews.Author: Michael D. Lowdermilk
Reviews.Content: Since getting the Vizio LED LCD-TV, I have found the setup was easy with the remote control and the built in Menu on-screen.  The audio was crisp and clear at loud volumes as well as low.  Picture quality was outstanding also.  I think this Vizio 26" LED LCD-TV may just be the perfect TV.  Also, I use this new Vizio as a computer monitor and it works great as a monitor too.  I haven't hooked the monitor to the web yet but I plan to do this soon.  I has already asked me to update the apps by connecting it to the internet.  I own three (3) other LCD TVs; one Emerson 37", one Sharp 37" and one Vizio LCD-TV 20", when I compare my NEW Vizio 26" to my other TVs it beats all of them hands down....

Reviews.Title: Get rid of the motion blur and this television is very good
Reviews.Author: Brett Smith "smitbret"
Reviews.Content: Someone decided that Vizio needed a nice, stylish, TV with a good feature set that could be easily slim-mounted to a bedroom wall and not break the bank.  This is the TV that I would probably design myself for that purpose.It's a good LED, but black levels and overall PQ is not on par with the better LED sets and looks like a washed out, noisy piece of crap next to my plasma.  That being said, I have been unable to finish properly calibrating the set to my fairly high standards, so I expect the tv will perform nicely once I get that done.  Very good off-angle viewing.  Motion blur is pretty nasty.  8ms pixel response time, so some blur is expected, but it is fairly distracting.  The ESPN sportsticker gets fairly smeared.  There are better TVs for action/sports, but it is very watchable and I'm not dissappointed. It performs as well as I would have expected for $370.  I don't see any real performance advantage from the LED but it does help it win style points.The sound is on par with other flat panel televisions.  You just can't expect great sound out of a flat panel tv.  There's no room for proper speaker construction.  Please people, stop complaining about it.  It's like being mad that your Honda Accord V6 came in last at the Daytona 500.  There are certain laws of physics that just can't be violated.Remote control is serviceable and fairly sturdy.  Controls are pretty intuitive.  The installation/initial boot-up process is a little drawn out, but that's what you get with an internet enabled tv.  Built in wireless N is awesome!  I may subscribe to Netflix just for this reason.Styling is very good.  Really thin and looks good on my wall.  Very light TV; you could probably safely mount it in sheetrock with a couple of standard drywall mounts, but I prefer to use a couple of screws in the stud to be safe.  HDMI and power connections are mounted parallel with the screen so a slim mount will work nicely since there are no cables sticking straight out the back to come into contact with the wall.

Reviews.Title: good tv!
Reviews.Author: anonymous
Reviews.Content: We've had the TV for a month now.  It's been great. I don't see the audio problems that some reviews have mentioned.  It may not be as great as a $1000-dollar high-end TV, but its way better than past TV's I've owned. Viewing angles are great.  Remote works well - seems flimsy at first, but its just simplistic.

Reviews.Title: very happy
Reviews.Author: joshua serna
Reviews.Content: love this tv, although the blacklighting doesnt work well with gaming...the rgb output looks better than the hdmi for my xbox which i dont like but other than that i do love the tv,

Reviews.Title: Awsome Internet TV
Reviews.Author: lms43614
Reviews.Content: This is an awsome TV except for the speakers.  Picture quality is great.  The only thing you have to do is hook-up some computer speakers and that takes care of the audio part of it.  Internet is great.

Reviews.Title: Vizio M261VP
Reviews.Author: Joshua T. Mills
Reviews.Content: First things first.Nice TV!Audio:Yes, everybody has ran into the cheap tinny sound this tiny tuner produces.If you're watching just cable/Dish on this TV, turn off the SRS audio options and normal viewingwill be much more enjoyed. As far as other media entertainment, Gaming consoles provide not muchhindrance towards cheap sounds when using SRS options. It's not as bad as everyone makes it to be,but Vizio could have still done much more to enhance it.Picture:Hot Dang! I'm loving this 100,000:1 contrast ratio in full HD! Especially with the darker blacksand vibrant whites the LED's emit! One of my favorite TV's so far (and computer monitor)Here's my main reason why I rated this product a 4/5. I have owned 4 other vizio TV's in the pastand many have had the same problem including this one. *If you're room temperature exceeds over 92 Degrees Fahrenheitthe TV will randomly shut off*. I've contacted Vizio about this problem many times. Unfortunately their responsesare very vague to why this occurs, but non-the-less, it's my fault for keeping my quarter doors shut to incubatethe living spaces (Keeping my pesky animals out to prevent any marking). If your house is well ventilated, you shouldn'thave any problems regarding this issue.Remote:I love the little remote's functionality!BE WARNED! Many of the Vizio commercials and info-videos seem as if you are getting the slide out QWERTY keyboard remote. You are not!The Vizio button in the center of the remote activates the TV's profile/internet applications which many are very handy and well appreciated!Overall I love this TV and do not regret purchasing it!

Reviews.Title: Happy with it
Reviews.Author: hsmithaz
Reviews.Content: Okay I read reviews before we bought this and was nervous because of others' problems with audio and their tv freezing or rebooting repeatedly but we got ours at Costco and they have a generous 3 month return policy so that gave me the confidence to make the purchase as well as the sale price of 279.99 which was an even better incentive and the fact that it has the applications/wigets was the cherry on top. My husband set the t.v up which we bought for our kids so they could watch Barney on netflix now we are not rich and this was still a lot of money to us so my review is critical... My daughters room is at the front of the house and our router is at the back of the house and the tv doesn't have the greatest range for wifi because it's not a strong signal BUT good enough to stream the videos and for us that is all that counts. The sound could be better and if you are buying this for your main TV you might want to save for an extra month to get a tv with better sound. The audio is flat there's no stereo effect no depth people refer to it as tinny but tinny makes me think of hollow or echoy and there is really no audio settings to change this as I had read there was. This TV is a great TV for a bedroom or small room as a secondary tv. Honestly we wouldn't have bought this tv if it wasn't for the netflix app and the fact that it was a great sale price.For us we got a good deal and I'm content with the tv and apps because it's not our main tv. My opinion isGreat secondary TVNot Great primary TV

Reviews.Title: plenty satisfied
Reviews.Author: lawvref
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV is amazing.  Everything just looks fantastic!  The built-in tuner found an HD version of every cable channel in our lineup (we have the most basic cable with 20 channels or so), so ow we have a free HD upgrade.  I don't know why anyone complained about the remote--it is plenty robust in my opinion.  The one downside which resonates through other reviews is the sound quality of the speakers.  You can't realistically expect amazing sound from speakers that small though.  If you are a real entertainment buff, you will have a sound system to go with the TV, and the speakers won't be an issue.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Picture- Poor Sound and Remote
Reviews.Author: William L. Woods
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is very good. The negative reviews on sound quality are correct. The speakers are not even adequate. I guess it's almost impossible to design a TV this thin and have decent sound. Then again, I have small FM radios which sound much better. The remote control does not respond as quickly as most and the keypad is poorly designed and the keys do not actuate as easily as other remotes. Also, the remote must be aimed in a narrow range vertically in order to work.I ended up buying a pair of AudioEngine A2 speakers to supplement the sound. Although these are great speakers, it's not an optimal solution. When using the TV headphone jack to connect with the speakers, the sound quality is improved, but shallow on the bass. I called Vizio customer support and found that the headphone and optical out outputs come from different sections of the sound circuitry. So I took a chance and got much better sound by utilizing the TV "Optical Out" to connect the speakers but then the volume controls of the remote cannot be used. In order to convert the Toslink, Optical Out cable to the speakers I bought a Optical Digital converter. I ended up leaving both connections set up and using the TV sound menu to switch between them depending on my preference.The reason I went to all this trouble instead of asking for a refund is the Vizio M261VP is the only 26" set that had the exact dimensions to fit under my cabinets above the counter. I wall mounted it and have 1/8" clearance top and bottom.

Reviews.Title: Worst sound ever!!
Reviews.Author: customer64
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV because it fit in the location we had available. Love the picture but the sound is horrible. Worst that a little kids tape player from years back. We had to by pass it and use other speakers.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: Timothy L. Kemmerly "kimtemmerly"
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of this TV before I bought it and was nervous about the audio quality. Decided to purchase it anyway and couldt be more happy with it.  Im just not sure what people are talking about when they say this tv has poor sound quality.  It sounds like a normal tv.  It doesnt melt your face when you turn it on but it really does the job and the picture cant be beat for a 26" tv.  Internet Apps took maybe a second to set up.  Love this tv and very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: A LOT OF TV FOR THE MONEY
Reviews.Author: Peter D Giatrakis
Reviews.Content: CLASS "A" PRODUCT ! ! !PROs1. Beautiful picture (1080p)2. Awesome price ( Worth every penny )3. Very efficient use of electricity (L.E.D.)4. Very light weight for installation ( great for RV &/or camping)5. Has the ability to upgrade its applications ( NETFLIX IS AWESOME)6. TWO HDMI inputs.CONs1. It's not free.2. It does not pay me to watch it.3. It needs a full QWERTY remote.4. Needs a refrigeration funnel so I can pour my beer in the top and collect it "cold" out the bottom.Have had many Sony TVs over the years..... the score "SONY 5, VIZIO 11 ! !"GOOD RIDDANCE SONY ........... "HELLO VIZIO ! ! !"peter d giatrakis

Reviews.Title: Great bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: MurfUnit
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for use in my study. 26" is the perfect size and the price was rightPicture quality is excellent.Features are great for a unit in this price category.Sound leaves a lot to be desired, but I knew that going into the purchase and always intended to add external speakers to the setup. It's hard to get decent sound from a unit as slim as this one.More than enough inputs for even the most extensive home theater setup. Plenty of room for expansion.Build quality leaves much to be desired though. The frame is a glossy black plastic that just doesn't feel substantial to me. I don't like grasping the sides of the TV to reposition it and feeling the seams 'click' together every time I do so.All in all if you're looking for a well priced LED TV for use in a bedroom or office you can't go wrong with this one.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV-great picture. Internet not all inclusive.
Reviews.Author: stevienov
Reviews.Content: Nice TV with an excellent picture. However, I'm coming from a 10 year old 21" Toshiba that I could connect a single composite video output to my projector and watch TV on the living room wall, which was great for sports and movies. This Vizio has no such output nor any video outputs. There is only 1 audio output to connect to a stereo system, but it is optical audio, which may require a conversion kit to use with my existing stereo. The USB input didn't work (which was frustrating as I had just looked at pictures from my USB memory stick on a friend's new 21" Samsung the night before). After digging into the manual, it states that the USB is for Vizio Technicians only. Thanks but no thanks for advertising the USB input, Vizio!Finally, I expected to entertain friends with YouTube videos through the Vizio Internet Apps. Unfortunately, the TV comes with pre-loaded apps much like a smart phone and I was unable to get YouTube videos on the TV. Vizio directed me to a website called Flingo which is supposed to let you send videos to the TV from your computer via a WiFi connection, but after trying for two days to get it to work with YouTube, I gave up. The Vizio Webvideo app on the TV does have many great videos, but also some raunchy ones, which was a bit disappointing. The sports apps are laughable - not even worth the time. Facebook is definitely a scaled down version. There is a nice music app, however, which allows you to get radio stations from all over the world. Since I'm comparing it to my old Toshiba, I'll probably keep it; but I did expect more from a new model TV

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Netflix streaming flawless, Super Clear
Reviews.Author: R. LUCAS "RustyGumbo"
Reviews.Content: First off, I got a steal of a deal on this tv for $288.  At that price I was skeptical of quality, but after 2 months of use, it has performed great.Fine tuning your picture:  You have to do some fine tuning on your picture.  The first thing I noticed was that this tv didn't seem very bright.  We turned off the background control and the picture became vibrant and crystal clear immediately.  I highly suggest spending a good hour tweaking this unit... and you need to fine tune it for every input.  I am using 2 HDMI's and the Components and had to fine tune each of them separately.Second, this tv is very thin, so don't expect the sound quality of a large box tv.  There is no room in this tv for speakers to create a nice full sound.  You won't find a tv this thin that will.  If you aren't familiar with sound, speakers require a lot of space to produce sound.  The older box tvs didn't produce fantastic sound either, but they do sound better than these thin flat panels.  If you want to improve your sound quality, you will have to connect to a stereo... or you can go a much less expensive route and purchase computer speakers and plug them in.  I'd suggest those with 2 satellite speakers and a amplified woofer box.  You can find these starting at $25 on up to several hundred.  You get what you pay for, so don't expect the world for under $50 because it isn't there, but you will get a big improvement.  Just make sure you find a speaker system that is shielded otherwise you may have issues with background noise (this is the speaker, not the tv).Third, the apps on this TV are great.  I have watched several Netflix movies streamed through the apps on this tv.  Flawless, crystal clear picture.  TV was very simple to set up the wireless connection.  If you find streaming slow, it is likely your internet speed, not the tv.Fourth, clarity is superb when connected to HD cable or DVDs/Blue Ray.  If you connect it to standard definition, you'll likely be disappointed because standard def channels are all over the place.  Some channels use standard tv dimensions, others use widescreen settings, etc.  HDTVs have trouble with lower resolution.  Lettering can look fuzzy.  This is an issue with all HDTVs.Finally, we purchased this for our bedroom to replace our old 27" big box tv. It was the best choice.  It looks fantastic and works great.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this TV!
Reviews.Author: Beth
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV for our bedroom the day after Christmas.  What an excellent TV!  Set up was quick and easy, it has a gorgeous picture, sound is wonderful, and we LOVE how easy it is to stream Netflix right to the TV.  I know others have complained about the sound, but ours is just in the bedroom so we have no issues at all with the sound.  And we have had no issues with connecting to the internet at all.  I think we've watched it almost every single night since we got it, and its never disconnected once.  My only word of warning: if you get this TV for your bedroom, you may never want to leave!  :)

Reviews.Title: barely lived past the warranty!
Reviews.Author: johnnybahama
Reviews.Content: Bought a 26" Vizio flat screen for our beach condo we visit maybe 6 times per year. Less than 3 months after the 1 year warranty expires the remote fails to operate the TV. Put in fresh batteries and still nothing. I purchased a universal remote and still nothing. I called their help line and got a tech to troubleshoot the TV. Final diagnosis was the remote sensor was bad. They told me it was out of warranty but gave me a case number and an email to fax a copy my receipt of purchase.After doing this I got an email the same day with a number to call about my case - so far so good! Then the woman answered and she was the turning point! She was argumentive and not helpful at all. She appeared to already be having a bad day and was taking it out on me. She told me it could be the remote (The odds of the other two being bad are ???). She told me there was nothing they would do as the TV was out of warranty. Yes, it was out by less than three months and had only been used a handful of times!It appears to me Vizio builds a product designed to last no longer than it's warranty. I have heard they build a special version (cheaper) just for Wal-Mart where I bought mine. Yes, I saved $20 bucks buying a Vizio but bought an inferior product. Take my advice and spend the extra money for a quality brand and save yourself the aggravation, and the hostile people at the Vizio "Customer Service" (oxymoron) department. I know I'll never purchase another Vizio product with such poor quality and lack of support.

Reviews.Title: Beware of horrible sound
Reviews.Author: liftsbytom
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv at my local Costco for a bit less than Amazon and I should have listened to the other reviewers about sound.  Sounds like you are stuck in the middle of a tin can.  Even hooked up a set of Bose speakers to it and while it sounded a bit better it was still BAD.  Returned it to my Costco store and they guy said that he had seen more of these returned than any tv in memory.  I have 3 other Vizio's XVT42, 47 and 55 and love them but this one is a turd.  Purchased the LG 26LE5300, from Amazon, and it is awesome, decent sound out of the little speakers and when hooked to the Bose small computer speakers sounds great, for what they are.  Not a review writer but wanted to save some of you from a mistake.

Reviews.Title: Rating it as a Computer Monitor
Reviews.Author: ILAffiliate
Reviews.Content: Purchased this locally to use on a PC. Picture is fine as a TV, but it's rated for up to 1920x1024 resolution for PC use. This is too high of a resolution for this screen size. everything is way too small. Normally the solution to this would be to downsize the resolution to the next level. But on this TV the two next lower, most common, industry standard resolutions are missing (1366x768, 1280x768). The next available resolution is 1024x768 which throws the TV into an old SD format narrow box and makes half the screen unusable.None of this is on the box. The box doesn't even mention a remote control.At 1920x1024 the screen needs A LOT of adjustment to get it readable without a lot of aliasing. Eventually had to up the font size to 120DPI thru the windows control panel to get it readable.Also the WiFi on this set doesn't appear to have a deactivate option. Not using it, but I wouldn't want the WiFi trying to connect to the neighbors all day.Some reviews have mentioned a firmware update that fixes the sound. Mine came with C1.2.24_rc0. I didn't try sound, but there was no option anywhere to do firmware update checks. After about 24 hours, it did a background firmware update that added some features such as HDMI CEC and Ambient Light Sensing, but no useful screen resolutions. Firmware updated to C3.2.33_RC3This may be a good TV, but it is not a good computer monitor. Without the standard screen sizes, it has to be returned in favor of a another brand.Prior to this I had a Hitachi L32BD304 32in TV which was able to handle the larger screen format and was all around better out of the box.Next up will be the S27B350H monitor from Samsung which supports a variety of screen resolutions.TV makers should design computer monitors and then add tuners instead of designing TVs and then adding computer support.Ideally, I'd like to see 30-32in computer monitors with 1920x1080 or higher resolution, HDMI, OTA tuner and PIP support. A computer monitor that could allow PIP from broadcast or cable TV without having to stream or use a WinTV card in the PC would be ideal.

Reviews.Title: Like watching TV on a clock radio
Reviews.Author: drperkins
Reviews.Content: If you plan on using your own speakers with this TV then it's a great buy. Otherwise the sound is awful, it literally sounds like a clock radio. I've had phones with better speakers than this. Vizio should be ashamed to push this crap on people.

Reviews.Title: Worst TV Purchase Ever
Reviews.Author: Reviewer1
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV because it fit the place I wanted to put it.  It was a mistake.  The sound quality was terrible.
