Most flat screens do not have great sound but this TV has just plain bad sound.  What is a greater concern is that after18 months the TV just died.  Though it had been lightly used it just stopped working.  The warranty had expired and the cost of dealing with Vizio  repair is more than buying a new TV.  Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Never Buy From This Company!!! EVER!!!
Reviews.Author: RAPadoodle
Reviews.Content: Such a horrible experience! They sent me a broken TV from the beginning and wouldn't return my phone calls. Once they finally got in contact with me, they claimed that the TV was "Out of Warranty" and they couldn't do anything about it. There are plenty of new TV's for sale that are cheaper than what they are asking for and are guaranteed to work. I will now be throwing $360 dollars in the trash because of all the things they had us do. The TV itself was $262 and then they sent us to a repair service that took $100 more dollars and broke the TV even more! All the repair company did was replace the power cord even though they promised they would go into the panel to figure out why they TV wasn't turning on and turning off by itself.Considering that my sister has the same exact TV that is also refurbished goes to show this it is just this company that does not provide good service.(She got her TV from a different company a year earlier.)NEVER BUY FROM THIS COMPANY! THEY WILL CHEAT YOU OF YOUR MONEY!!!!!

Reviews.Title: do not buy!
Reviews.Author: Andrew Craven
Reviews.Content: the tv works, sound it ok, picture is actually pretty good. but the apps SUCK, the whole software built into this is absolutely AWFUL. they never update it, or fix it. Its slow and laggy as all hell. Riddled with bugs and issues, they churn out so many different models they dont care to ever go back and fix or update anything they've put out.

Reviews.Title: Great while it lasted
Reviews.Author: SD CAL GUY
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv from Costco in May 2011.  The first one I had to switch out in the first 30 days because it kept shutting off, but the replacement worked great for 2+ years and then just today the remote sensor went bad on the tv and the service center said the part had to be replaced.  Thankfully I got it at Costco, because its going back there for a full replacement now.

Reviews.Title: good for a spare room
Reviews.Author: Raymond J. Rizzuto "rjrizzuto"
Reviews.Content: No complaints about this tv, though I would only use it in a small room since it is on the small size (these days).  Funny that I remember how wonderful it was when we got a 19" color tv back when I was a kid!

Reviews.Title: Updated review: Good picture, lousy internet apps (and no updates!)
Reviews.Author: Neil Rosenberg "The real Neil"
Reviews.Content: I'm going to have to get an external streaming video product (Roku?) because the "famed" Vizio Internet Apps are getting really long in the tooth, and there's no apparent update coming.  The Netflix app is so old it lacks all kinds of features that are commonplace with other Netflix boxes, like the ability to sequence to the next video in a series.  Each time we power up this puppy, we have to manually search through sometimes dozens of episodes we've already watched to get to the next one we haven't seen.  It doesn't even group the episodes into seasons (season 1, 2, etc.), you have to scroll through ALL of the episodes to get to the one you want.There are lots of other Netflix and Amazon gotcha's that make using it truly painful.  For example the Amazon app has no "My list", so you can't make any attempt at saving a favorite show for future viewing.  Ridiculous.It's not that I expect Vizio to compete head-on with Roku (for example) but they could at least try to keep current.As a plain old HD tv this unit is fine.My 2c.Further info, 9/16/2013: Just spoke with Vizo tech support.  According to him they have several different main versions of firmware, and they have to work "hand in hand" with each of the app providers (i.e. Netflix) to coordinate every update.  Long story short, they *may* get around to updating any particular firmware version at some point, but they are seriously behind at this time.  To me, sounds like a losing battle.  Roku here we come...

Reviews.Title: Sound Makes This TV Unusable
Reviews.Author: Sean Higgins "Sean"
Reviews.Content: First the pros- Great picture, the apps work great along with the wi-fi, and the unit is sleek and small.Cons- It is hard to express how bad the sound really is on this tv. If you put a cat in a dryer and hooked a tin can with a string to it you would be close. It is really the worst sound I have ever heard coming from anything. If you cranked up earbuds from 3-feet away they would sound better. It is so bad it makes it unusable. Unfortunately it is the entire sound processing in the tv that is to blame. If you hook up external speakers directly to the tv they still sound terrible... just louder. I even tried Bose speakers. And yes, I tried all the settings. I had to plug external speakers right into my cable box so that I could stop cringing when watching and listening. This totally defeated the purpose of getting a small tv for my bedroom. Bummer.

Reviews.Title: expensive junk
Reviews.Author: Roberta
Reviews.Content: Purchased Vizio M261VP TV 10/30/2011. We had it in our exercise room so use was minimal, 2-3 hours a week so it has minimal hours of use on it. Video went out 8/12/13 and had audio only. A call to Vizio and they couldn't fix it. We've had box TV's that have lasted over 15 years now, but the Vizio lasted less than 2. We won't replace it with another Vizio and I would suggest those considering purchasing Vizio look at the problems they've been having with their chips in the TV's on their Vizio website.

Reviews.Title: Warranty 12 months Product life 16 months
Reviews.Author: MJM "handy electronics"
Reviews.Content: I had purchased this Vizio M261VP from Sam's Club however want to warn all buyers of Vizio quality, at least on this TV M261VP.The TV does have a great picture and the sound quality is not so good, however I think maybe a trade-off for the slim design makes this acceptable.This TV was used in a bedroom and used at most a few hours a day for the evening news. TV's usable life is short due to fast changing technology , however that is not the case for this Vizio TV, it comes with a 12 month warranty and various problems start in the 13th month. Please look up all the reviews on various websites and you will see this same complaint. If you need to buy extended warranties and accept the idea of repairs in years 2 to 4 after purchase then you should consider this in the total cost of the products. My LG and Panasonic just didn't need extended warranties, conclusion products with better quality are much lower cost in the big picture.

Reviews.Title: Fits our needs for the space
Reviews.Author: Kermit Van Roekel
Reviews.Content: Like the LED feature, wish the refresh speed was faster, but for the money it was a good deal.  It came as expected, we have 47 inch version so knew what to expect for capabilities..

Reviews.Title: Continued problems with TV
Reviews.Author: Francisco J. Reyes "Francisco"
Reviews.Content: The good: Good value for the features.The bad: TV prone to problems.At least once or twice a month the TV needed to be reset with blinking on indicator. Now a year and 4 months after purchase the TV lost video (still has sound).Sadly it seems this TV is prone to having the problems I experienced as I found many other people with the same problems.Last Update:.. Cost of repair estimated at $250. Not worth repairing when for similar price one can buy a new TV. This basically make Vizio TV a 1.5  year disposable TV. Based on all the problems I saw other people had this will be the last Vizio product I will purchase.

Reviews.Title: All expected and more
Reviews.Author: blh
Reviews.Content: Sharp Picture and smart sound is great. BEST smaller screen HDTV around- Extended warranty from Square Trade adds to its value

Reviews.Title: Don't buy list of TVs
Reviews.Author: Barbara Osborn
Reviews.Content: To whom it may concern,I bought a Vizio M261VP about a year and a half ago. We seldomly use it and within a year the TV had small startup issues. These problems have manifested and the TV won't turn on.Please review other people's comments before buying this product.Secondly the TV's volume sucks. Must crank the volume in order to hear it.This will be the first and last Vizio product in my household ever.

Reviews.Title: was great while it lasted- and then it quit
Reviews.Author: noobiedoc
Reviews.Content: I bought this set almost a year ago. The picture was great while it lasted. The internet apps are great, obviating the need for a third party device. But just as my warranty ran out, the backlight started giving up, and now there are multiple shadows on the screen. I am told repairing this requires replacing the whole backpanel, and that would end up costingg me more than half the price of the set itself. I was actually thinking of buying a bigger vizio set to replace this, but now I am done with all Vizio sets, and I am actually a little leery of all LED sets in general- it hasnt been long since this sets have been around, and after a bad experience with thsi one, I dont know if i would invest in another led set. If anything, I would be very leery of Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Nice unit
Reviews.Author: N. Kacena "Stub01"
Reviews.Content: Nice black VIZIO M261VP 26-Inch 1080p LED LCD HDTV that was easy to set up and works well.  Sound is OK, but a sound bar adds considerably...

Reviews.Title: Works great.
Reviews.Author: Richard G Fish "Dadz"
Reviews.Content: This unit is about the size of a large, flat screen, computer monitor, but it fit in the space that we had our old CRT TV and the picture is basically the same size.  It has been working well.  Much better picture than our old TV.It was a little challenging to setup, because our cable box is not High Definition.  I decided to connect it through a VCR/DVD combo and then through a sound bar.  Originally I wanted to run the signal to the TV and then the sound to the sound bar, but the audio output on the TV was optical and the sound bar was analog.  This has become a slight disadvantage for us, because it takes four remotes to get the thing running and if you don't do it in the correct order, you end up with a black and white picture.We have had this TV for a year and we are very satisfied.  We would definitely buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Rating my Visio TVs
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Roach
Reviews.Content: I am enjoying the TV's...nice picture quality.Wish I had ordered 1 32" instead of 2 26".Any possibility that I can exchange one of the 26" TV's for a 32".  Please let me know.Thank you,  Kathleen Roach

Reviews.Title: Such a deal
Reviews.Author: Jerry R. Seiling
Reviews.Content: I bought this refurbrished and it's a good as brand new.  Easy to set up and includes everything needed to go immediately onto the internet.  I bought this for my bedroom as it matches the 42" Visio I have in my living room.I'm a happy camper and have totally disconnected from cable and stream everything I now watch online.Probably the nicest thing is the ease of setup and not having to buy more equipment as you do with "Internet Ready" devices.Let the buyer beware of that label.

Reviews.Title: Needs a web browser app badly
Reviews.Author: Maylon Taylor
Reviews.Content: Specs & TV match up as expected... Vizio is "hocking" their internet connection now in a separate (google browser) box for $100 dollars.... doesn't seem to be any motivation by Yahpoop to include an "VIA" to accomplish this with the TV only!! Important if one intends to access websites independantly. DOES NOT USE IOS/ANDROID APPS FOR THIS PURPOSE AS SOME OTHER MAKES DO!!

Reviews.Title: STL PRO as a seller of Vizio Products
Reviews.Author: J. Howard
Reviews.Content: STL PRO sold us a Vizio TV in May 2012. It worked for a few months and then began to have video problems. We contacted Vizio to get it fixed since the TV was under Warranty. WE were promptly told that Vizio would not honor any warranty with the seller STL PRO because they were not authorized Vizio sellers. STL PRO would not fix or allow a return since it was past their 15 day return date.  STL PRO did not remark in the information regarding the TV that Vizio would not honor warranties. They did however tell me that after the purchase. I had notified AMAZON that warranty information was not provided and they said the seller posted their return policy and it was too late to return. No one got the fact that I just wanted this fixed. STL PRO also eluded to the fact that maybe I dropped or hit the TV to cause the problems. I'm 60 years old, didn't drop it or hit it.  This is the first time I have had issues with Vizio but I caution you , the consumer , when you purchase from STL PRO.

Reviews.Title: Great 26" Monitor- Television
Reviews.Author: Matthew R. Jacks
Reviews.Content: It took me years to convince my folks who are in there 80's to graduate from a CRT - Tube style monitor with its curved shiny screen to a flat screen.  I bought the first at a big box, which only had a max 780p and of course it wasn't clear enough.  (switching to flat screen takes some ocular adjustment)I couldn't find any 1080p TV's where I live so I ordered this here and they LOVE IT!As others have said the speakers are a bit tinny.. but for a few bucks you can buy some cheap computer speakers to fix that.Easy set-up.

Reviews.Title: Vizio Warranty ONLY from Authorized Resellers
Reviews.Author: Aaron
Reviews.Content: Edge/Back light had issues after 6 months.  Vizio won't replace because it wasn't purchased from an Authorized Retailer (TechNGnet).  Make sure the seller will cover the 1 year listed warranty on the page before you purchase. In the process of contacting the reseller to find out what they will do.Otherwise TV has a good display.  Colors are good, but images are fuzzy if plugged into a computer through anything but VGA.

Reviews.Title: vizio m261vp
Reviews.Author: blazed420
Reviews.Content: Great t.v. , great picture, love the video apps, good options,no other t.v. this size has this good of a picture or half the options

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my new Kitchen - LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: A. Morgan
Reviews.Content: Decided that I wanted to allocate a space in my kitchen remake to a TV that we could watch while cooking, eating, whatever.  But I couldn't go with too large of a unit.  I thought 26" was about right, and designed my upper cabinets to accommodate a unit of this size.Then I ran across this - and was hooked.  I've had it installed for about 4 months now, and couldn't be happier.  The display quality is excellent, at any angle we've tried.  Despite comments I've read about the poor sound, honestly, I don't have any problems with it.  It's a Kitchen, not a recording studio!Anyway - even though I have the ability to put a hard-wired Ethernet to the set, I've discovered that I really don't have to, our home WiFi connection is perfectly adequate.  So I've got my Netflix configured, along with some of the other applets available with the TV, and all is terrific!I was a little nervous about Vizio, having mostly stuck with Sony or Panasonic over the years, but neither of them are still offering a 26" unit like this.  So I gave it a try, and am really happy.It is funny when you can do an online update of the system software/BIOS - and there were a few after it was unpacked.  But they've all worked well, and improved the available features.The only issue I had with it was one of documentation, not technology.  Had a devil of a time removing the stand from the unit, since it was to be mounted on the wall of the cabinet.  Finally found an online thread where a consumer gave the clues on how to remove the stand.  Then, all was fine.  But my contractor put a small crease in the lower edge of the grill trying to force the mounting pin out.  But fortunately it's not noticeable.

Reviews.Title: GREAT GREAT TV
Reviews.Author: Fujijohn "fuji_john"
Reviews.Content: Vizio must have improved the sound on this tv.  The old tv in my kitchen that I replaced with this vizio has a good sound but I normally put in at 25-27.  Believe it or not with this vizio I turned it down to 13-15 because it is so loud!  The picture is so vivid, I have not used the internet yet as I don't have much time.  But so far I love this tv and won't hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: Picture Awsome Sound Lousy
Reviews.Author: Richard J Czaporowski
Reviews.Content: If you buy this you WILL need to get a sound bar. The built in speakers sound like a transistor radio.

Reviews.Title: good tv
Reviews.Author: jpm
Reviews.Content: Good TV.  Wish it would switch from channel to channel faster. It has a very nice picture.  The sould could be a little better.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV, Not So Awesome Sound
Reviews.Author: R. Spoto
Reviews.Content: I hemmed and hawed over this TV in the store, and after reading reviews passed it up (due to sound complaints). I wound up receiving one as a gift.I couldn't be more pleased! The picture is great, and the Internet apps work very well. Vudu works great, Facebook, Twitter, and just about any other Yahoo widget is at your fingertips.  Netflix works very well also.The styling is nice, and it is extermely thin and light. The included stand does the job just fine, and matches the rest of the TV.The remote control isn't all that hot. It's bulky/boxy, and feels like I'm using a remote control from the 50s/60s when I push the buttons. It works fine, but just feels "wrong". Luckly I had an old Logitech Harmony I set up to work perfectly with it.My only complaint is, you guessed it, the sound!! It's terrible! Transistor radio or really cheap radio sound actually may have a leg up on this! VERY tinny with no dynamic sound whatsoever. I went out and bought a $15 pair of computer speakers to hook up to the headphone jack. They're not fantastic either, but a marked improvement over the built-in speakers! If Vizio did one thing to this TV it should be to improve the audio!! if you're going to connect it to a home theater setup or sound bar via the digital optical out, then no worries. Otherwise, you might want to pick up a pair of computer speakers.The video is crisp and sharp in HD, and even the SD looks pretty good (certainly beats my old 19" tube!). It does change channels a little slow, but there's a pop-up channel list that's decent to use for quickly popping around.To sum it up, if sound isn't an issue for you, buy this TV!! 26" is perfect for a bedroom for run-of-the-mill TV fun.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture !! Had to use a Home Theater for Great Sound ...
Reviews.Author: R. Hackley "Rick Hackley"
Reviews.Content: Picture is great.  I also like all the availability of all of the Internet programs and apps.I am able to confirm a previous review which commented on how awful the audio sounded when using the headphone output to any kind of powered speakers or a home theater.  I unplugged the optical cable from my 55" Vizio TV and plugged it into this TV and "VOILA" .. awesome audio sound.I could not find a sound bar that would work with this TV.  It is 24" and the smallest width for any sound bar was about 33".  After searching about 15 web sites, I located a Samsung Model:HTD4500 home theater system. The center and front speakers are small and crisp and fit right in front of the TV.  The subwoofer is more than adequate for this size TV.  As I have this set up in a home office, I chucked out the rear speakers and am quite happy with a 3.1 this 3.1 audio setup.  I found the Samsung at HH...g for only $199... great deal!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV with major audio flaws
Reviews.Author: Joe Prefect
Reviews.Content: In general the TV is great. I'm very happy with the TV.  Setup was fast simple.  It connected easily to my home wireless network.  The picture is very nice with HD content.  I stream Netflix to the TV often over the wireless and it works great.The TV has major audio flaws which may or may not affect you.The built in speakers don't get very loud and the sound is pretty average.  This is not uncommon for a smaller TV and not a big problem for most people.  But the MAJOR AUDIO FLAW is that all the bass is filtered out of the headphone output jack on the back.  I searched the web and this is a common complaint for this TV.  If you don't use the headphone output, then this problem won't impact you.  For me it was a major pain.  I'll explain...I installed the TV in my basement "home gym".  So, I could stream NetFlix wirelessly while running on my treadmill.  I didn't expect the built in speakers to be loud enough to be heard over the sound of the treadmill and my panting/wheezing.  So, I had planned to use an old PC speaker system with subwoofer.  These speakers plug into the headphone jack.  This is when I found the problem.  Watching TV with only the higher pitched sounds was not enjoyable.  The only work around I could find was to use the TVs optical audio out.  To do this you either need to use a stereo with optical input or an optical to analog converter.  I did the latter...I purchased a "FiiO D3 Digital to Analog Audio Converter" from amazon (~$25) and RCA-to-headphone audio cable (~$5).  The converter allowed me to plug in my old PC speaker system.  The sound is now fantastic!  But.....the volume of the optical output on the TV is NOT controlled by volume by the TV remote control.  This is not really that unusual after I thought about it.  If you were plugging optical directly into a stereo this wouldn't be a problem.  But for me using my PC speakers it was.  So, now I need to buy a remote volume control to put inline with the FiiO device.  There is a "Koss VC20 Volume Control" available on amazon for $7 that should work.  This will work for me because my TV is right next to my treadmill.  If your TV was across the room you'd need a different solution.  It's a bit of a pain to have to keep working around the Visio headphone output flaw.I'd recommend the FiiO Digital to Analog converter in general and for use with the TV.  The sound is really good.Again, overall GREAT TV with average or below average sound from the build in speakers.  But with the only functioning audio out being the optical out, it may not work with your planned setup without some add-ons to work around the audio flaws.

Reviews.Title: sound is terrible
Reviews.Author: ej
Reviews.Content: The picture is great but the sound is just awful!  Had to buy a $100 sound bar and optic cable to be able to stand to have the TV on.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy!  Audio is so poor its painful
Reviews.Author: Bill from Delaware "Bill"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item without first looking at it in a store because it seemed to be the only smaller smart tv set where I could get NetFlix directly.  I have to say that most of the rest of the TV is adequate but other negatives include very slow channel changing and very slow boot up for the TV.  I would suggest that you look at the 40" Sony or Samsung smart TVs and pay a little more and avoid this set.  There is really no excuse to have the audio be so poor on this set.  Very disappointing and clearly unsustainable from a long run perspective as other units will knock this one off the market with time.

Reviews.Title: Great update for my Monaco motor home!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I pulled the old heavy and bulky Sony 24" out of the over dash cabinet, removed the cabinet and just about cut it in half and re-installed it--- making the whole unit 5" higher and 8" deeper)now flush to the side units.  I added the Vizio 26" flat screen HD unit in the space and it looks like a factory install.  The major complaint that I read was about the sound quality but I took the headphone output (it REALLY should have audio outputs!!!) and ran it into the existing Sony DVD/Amp unit already in place and put in Avatar---  THE SOUND IS THEATRE QUALITY!!  It probably has more to do with the amp but the sound couldn't be better.  Regular TV is just fine.  By unplugging the headphone jack you can go back to the built in speakers, which are sorta ok, but this is a really great unit with picture quality, internet app's (haven't gotten a chance to try them yet, but I have no doubt they'll be ok too) and a really good price.  Buy it, try it & love it!

Reviews.Title: My review Video & Audio performance
Reviews.Author: Amazon customer
Reviews.Content: We just took delivery of our first Vizio M261VP.  The video has excellent detail, resolution, and color, but the AUDIO is a BIG dissapointment.  We have two other smaller size TVS and both have MUCH better Audio.  This Audio is like hearing sound from a CAN--yep, reminds me of a CAN.  Even after adjusting, can't remove the distinct annoying hollowness sound. It's like the speakers are enclosed in a thin-metal casing that produces this poor audio.It's like getting a Toyota Lexus with cheapest speaker audio system.  Do I sound dissappointed ?This was my first Vizio, and last Vizio.  Unfortunatly, Vizio lost creditibility in our house.  The R&D; team should take more care in releasing products like this.But the Video is great!!

Reviews.Title: Screen failed within 4 months
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV in May and liked it a lot.  But by September the screen was going black and then went completely black in a couple more weeks.  Vizio wants me to pay to have the unit packed and shipped back to them under warranty.  Uh . . . ??  Not an inexpensive prospect.  They ought to send me a new TV and a shipping label to return the defective one--almost no questions asked. Anyway, I'm not impressed with Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Nice image
Reviews.Author: A.M "Adrian"
Reviews.Content: This TV is pretty good, image is awesome. Wireless access and updates are fine even when the TV is off. The only bad thing I have found is NTSC which only supported in 26" version.Low energy consuptiom, this tv is great :)

Reviews.Title: Brian
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: I've now had this TV for just over a couple months. It's been great thus far! The only problem I've had is with Vizio customer service. I'd contacted them about how to get an app linked because it didn't seem to be working. However, they claimed that they needed 'my life story' just to answer a simple question.Oh... well we need your address, amount you paid, serial/model number...Uh... no, you don't.Back to the TV.I wanted a TV that fit just right in the vertically measured space I have available for it. I'd purposely did the measurement and chose to order this "26 inch" because it was the biggest I could get to fit my space.I got the TV, set it up and immediately (of course) realized I could've gotten a bigger TV.So... I doubt the measurements for this TV as stated on this page is correct.At least it's smaller so it fits my space.I got a refurbished unit and it only cost about $255 including shipping. So... overall, I'm happy.

Reviews.Title: A Bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: Thomas Lewis "Septegenarian Putterer"
Reviews.Content: I knew going into this TV that the sound was less than good, it is, however, acceptable.There is a headphone jack that I can use with my Sony wireless headset to watch TV and not disturb my sleeping spouse.Over all, I think I made a good buy, I hope it is a reliable unit, I did purchase coverage from "Square Trade" just to make sure the unit won't cost me an arm and a leg if it fails.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Mbloch
Reviews.Content: Great value for the price. Perfect for a bedroom TV.  I had bought a 32" and it was a large for a small bedroom.  This one is perfect size.  Apps are cool.

Reviews.Title: love this tv
Reviews.Author: cheryl
Reviews.Content: I did a fair amount of research and bought this Vizio 26 inch to wall mount on my bedroom wall. And I am very happy with it. The picture is great! Easy to hook up. A snap in fact. I have only used it for about 3 weeks or so but never has crashed as I read someone say.. everything is great. Except for the sound. But thanks to the reviews I wasn't exspecting good sound. I mainly use head phones and I can adjust the volume which is great. And when I am not using head phones I hook it up to my older JBL creature speakers and its just fine. If you are looking for amamzing sound I would hook it up using the opticial and some good surround speakers. But on a smaller set the sound is never going to be amazing anyways.  I also have a sony 35 inch which has good sound for a flat screen and I still hook up other speakers for better sound..but the vizio rocks.. its a great tv...and its super thin and light wieght so mounting it was no problem even on my very thin walls..the picture is amazing and the wifi is great!

Reviews.Title: great for the price
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: Picture quality great sound ok for a small tv  the only thing confusing is the playback of video files and not reading my usb drive at times or it reads it initially but can't find it and have to unplug and re plug in

Reviews.Title: Awesome LEDTV/Monitor
Reviews.Author: WINTER
Reviews.Content: I love this TV. The picture is awesome, and response time great. I am running this as a monitor off HDMI through an HIS IceQ 6850 video card and it is phenominal. I also have a PS3 hooked up and digital cable. Movies and games come to life, all in a thin, glossy, good looking package.The sound is ok, nothing spectacular, but I bought this never intending to use the TV speakers. It is hooked up to an ASUS Xonar sound card and Kenwood Fineline home theater system.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture, Good Sound, Great Buy
Reviews.Author: EPHiCS
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for my room and I was very happy when I received it. I like a lot of thing about this TV. One of them being that the video quality is so great. I also liked the built in apps feature and the wi-fi is a nice bonus. The remote is very sleek and fits nicely in your hands and is very easy to navigate.I was stunned at the video quality when watching blu-rays and 1080p movies with my WDTV and PS3. The video was flawless in every way and I have nothing to complain about. The audio on the other hand was good. When there's explosions and stuff, the noise isn't excellent but it's not terrible can sound. As for voices, it sounds great.I saw quite a few reviews complaining that the audio is low and the sound is bad but I have to disagree. The sound isn't excellent but it's good for a 26 inch TV. The audio goes up to 100 and I have mines on 25 when gaming and on 35 when viewing movies.In addition to movies, I use this TV for gaming and it does that great as well. The 8MS response time isn't perfect for gaming but it's very good. The video quality when gaming is not as excellent as when viewing movies but it's not bad. I would give the video quality when gaming a 8/10 and the video quality of movies a 10/10.A reviewer mentioned that the TV gets hot and freezes. This never happened to me with this TV. I game for around 4-5 hours a few days to test it out and the TV was very cool. I didn't experience any freezing as well. Maybe he got it refurbished or something.I am glad I got this TV and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a nice slim 26 inch tv for watching movies or gaming in their bedroom. I've had it for about three weeks now and I am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Soooooooo Nice!
Reviews.Author: iCoppa
Reviews.Content: This TV greatly exceded my expectations.  The picture is amazingly sharp.  1080p with a contrast ratio at 100,000 on a screen this small should be flawless and IT IS!  I hung this on the wall in the kitchen.  It takes up as much room as a framed picture.  With the LED technology, I can leave it running all day without running up the electric bill.  I only use the VIZIO Apps for the weather so I don't know how great that feature is overall.  But the weather app is a nice bonus.  I could go on an on but the NBA finals calling so I have to go.  The sound is not so good, but any device this thin would suffer the same fate.You will not regret this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Television!
Reviews.Author: Tony Hornsby
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews for this unit, I almost missed out on a great deal (from another site, though I always go to Amazon first).  Set up was pretty easy.  The picture is spectacular.  The apps are great (though I wish it had one for YouTube). For a bedroom television, it's perfect!Now to the sound.  I was also frustrated with how the audio seemed rather muted at first. Then I discovered the audio settings.  Once I turned off the 'SRS TruVolume', which I assume is to balance the audio for loud commercials, the audio was to be expected in any flat panel television of its size which is more than adequate.  You're not going to get Bose sound from factory speakers of any television manufacturer.  Once this 'feature' is turned off, it can get plenty loud for my liking.  If you need the audio at the best level, you probably should use a stereo/home theater system and use the audio outs from the source and/or use higher-end PC speakers in the case of using apps like netflix.  Overall, this was a great purchase.

Reviews.Title: SOLID TELEVISION - MET EXPECTATIONS
Reviews.Author: CALIBER
Reviews.Content: This television set did exactly what I was expecting.  I love the fact that I can watch TV with "no strings attached".  The WIFI option is awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV but not good sound
Reviews.Author: Tr3
Reviews.Content: I got this TV two weeks ago.  The set-up was easy even for me (if it requires a manual, it is too complicated).  The picture is quite good and crisp and the built-in Netflix app works great.  That said, the audio is terrible.  The other reviews were correct.  So I spent a few more bucks on a computer speaker system.  Now, the sound it all the way up to adequate.  Since this is a bedroom television, adequate works.  So if you need a smaller TV with built in internet, I highly recommend it with the idea that even if you are not an audiophile, you will need to do something to boost the sound.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO M261VP 26-Inch
Reviews.Author: Stanley S Kelsall Jr
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice HDTV, the picture is great, and the sound is more than enough for the kitchen area in which it is installed. The apps are also easy to set up and use.This set is installed on an under cabinet pivot mount and it appears to float in the air as it is only 1-inch shorter than the space between the counter top and the underside of the counter.It took a while to find a 26" 1080p HDTV with internet apps, but this unit was worth the wait.If you want a decent size 1080p screen for a tight space this is the unit you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: had to return
Reviews.Author: amapur
Reviews.Content: Vizio has potential, just not quite ready.  The remote control was a pain to use.  Had to hit everything twice, the internet connection dropped over and over and we had to re-enter our wireless password with the cheesy remote and keyboard.  Sound needs work.  The picture was great.  We returned it after a couple days of having to attempt to reconnect to the internet.  Instead we went with an apple tv box and a samsung tv and the results are much better.  Oh well.

Reviews.Title: Not sure what all the complaints are about...
Reviews.Author: J. Rowland "JasonNYC"
Reviews.Content: First of all, the audio is very good for just over a one inch thick TV set for under $300 (Costco).  If you are buying this TV for bedroom use and the occasional show and not as your full time TV for action movies then it will more than suffice.  Add the ability to get NetFlix alone and it is a keeper.  Sure, the sound is just okay but it does the job and then some.  Don't expect a BMW when you are paying Hyundai prices, and that's not a dig against Hyundai either.  It just is what it is.  It's great for a kitchen or small bedroom.  Put it in your living room and it will feel small and lonely and sound small and lonely as well.As for Apps, all of them are useless IMHO except NetFlix (maybe Pandora as well is worth it).  The TV is worth getting for that app alone for me.  One tv, one plug in the wall, one app and nothing else hanging on the wall or below but this thin tv with a lovely picture for the price.  A thing of beauty.  NetFlix has worked flawlessly for me.  One thing to note, I had it up and running via wifi in about 25 minutes out of the box and it was not so great.  Then within two hours the tv pushed an update and it has been perfect since that happened.  My router is more than 50 yards away from my bedroom and in a garage outside with several walls and my kitchen in the middle and I still get excellent signal.  Better signal that my iPad gets actually.  Unfortunately, wireless hardware is not a perfect thing and some people's mileage may vary.  So many factors are at play in whether your wifi works well or not and I think this tv gets a bad rap some times because of this fact.  Wifi is a fickle beast, even in 2011.  I have far from "ideal wifi conditions" in my home and I am still pleased.  Perhaps I am lucky.The remote is just okay.  It stinks at first during setup when you are getting all the apps and passwords going but once the tv is setup the remote is fine for general use.  I agree, it would be nice to have the slider keyboard attached but again, this tv is designed for occasional use at a price point almost anyone can handle.  It's not a 60 inch show panel for your living room with a ton of gadgets added on.  Keep that in mind and you will be happy with this tv. Drive it like a BMW and you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Audio is Acceptable
Reviews.Author: Stephen M. Prescott
Reviews.Content: The strength of this television is the feature set. You get built-in internet connectivity using both ethernet and WiFi, web applications including Netflix, 1080P resolution, LED lighting and good local connectivity including 2 HDMI ports. Other TVs offer some of these features but, to my knowledge, no other TV offers all of them.Based on the reviews I was anticipating bad sound but, to my ears, the sound is perfectly acceptable.

Reviews.Title: all but the sound
Reviews.Author: kevstaar
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous television for a bedroom, great picture and the wi-fi works well. Very easy to set up. The only negative is how absolutely horrible the sound quality is. Very tinny and shallow, no matter what you do. It has SRS, an equalizer, the ability to lag the picture just a touch to sync with the movement on the screen if its a bit off. But the audio sounds like it is coming from small soup cans. It does have an optical output for audio if you have a home theater setup, and a mini-jack for headphones. Maybe a set of multimedia speakers will make a difference.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful value, very good TV
Reviews.Author: Jane Anderson
Reviews.Content: If only the sound were better - the common complaint about TVs this size - the Vizio 26 would be fantastic. I bought this as part of a kitchen remodel and have used it for about a month. Picture is very good on regular cable (no HD box yet) with some tweaking in the controls. Audio is better with tweaking, but still kinda tinny compared to the tiny LCD TV it replaced. The external speakers (not Vizio - designed for computer instead, thanks to suggestions from other reviewers/forums - much cheaper) I got for Christmas should help.I have had no problems with crashing or freezing up. It IS slow to change channels, but not that different from a much older set I have.It is very cool to access instant-watch Netflix and watch a movie while I cook. Or access Pandora (or it will be when the sound quality is better). It makes me want a bigger version in the family room -- but not till the remodel bills are paid!!

Reviews.Title: Grab it for freaky best-in-class contrast specs! FANTASTI PICTURE from VIZIO M261VP!
Reviews.Author: S. J. Jackson "TALL BoNGo"
Reviews.Content: Stunning clarity, color, contrast! Adjusts perfectly to shifts in room light, direct streaming sun or shadow.  Rolled dice on refurbished model at 2012 New Year - spent less than $300 on this VIZIO.  Running through two Sony Components: Blu Ray Player BDP-480, and Stereo Reciever STR-520, through two small JBL Reference Monitors.  Ran 100ft of Cat7 Ethernet wire (another Amazon purchase) through nearly as much 1" PVC tubing under my cabin, hooked that directly to Sony BDP-480.  Grabbed some good/premium quality HDMI cables from well-reviewed Amazon vendors, saved a mint from brand names or buying at retail outlets. This is my entry into HD world, and it has been super sweet viewing so far.  Before I grabbed ethernet cable and Blu Ray Player, I was runnning (Amazon, Netflix) widgets from VIZIO HDTV wireless from modem for a couple of weeks, it worked okay, but occasional upload delays and a couple of crashes and the reality that best connectivity would come from direct cable hook up.  Plus why strain VIZIO HDTV with downloading/uploading chores, I bought to look better than others in its size.  It now has a single task, to present video feed as gorgeously as possible and IT DELIVERS that!  Did not buy this HDTV to deliver high quality, broad spectrum audio. What would I expect from a 26" finger thin TV that cost less than 3 bills? VIZIO's sounds is fine on its own for your average TV show. I balanced the VIZIO's tweeter sharp speakers with the JBL's and powered by the Sony amp, the sound at half-volume (40-45) is as broad, rich, deep, cabinet- and cabin-rattling as my family could want when watching Thor, Iron Man, Captain Jack Sparrow or Pride & Prejudice. If you want a small jewel of set, this one is precious!

Reviews.Title: Incredible Picture but Awful Sound - Here's The Fix!
Reviews.Author: Morpheus
Reviews.Content: Want to fix the audio problem?  This is a quote from my post on the Vizio website reviewing this model:  This model M261VP of Vizio has superb picture quality and superb angle viewing quality!  But there is a serious software bug regarding the Audio.  No Bass, and EQ or Basic Bass settings do not work at all.  Sounds like a sardine can.  Unbelievably awful audio!  Plug in headphones or connect powered speakers and same result!  Tin can sound!  Vizio should do a firmware fix for this but apparently they don't care or don't care to know of this widespread problem with this model.  SO I FIGURED OUT THE FIX FOR THIS PROBLEM!!!  Simply do this:  Go to Advanced Audio.  Turn off SRS TruSurround if it is on and keep it off!  Scroll down 2 steps to Digital Audio Out.  If it is set to PCM then switch to Dolby Digital.  If it is set to Dolby Digital then switch to PCM.  If it is set to OFF then switch to either PCM or Dolby Digital and then back to either Dolby Digital or PCM.  It does not matter which one because the act of switching will restore all BASS sound and the EQ settings will now work completely.  Now go to Equalizer settings and set both the 100mhz and 300mhz sliders all the way up.  The middle (1000mhz) at -4 and the last 2 at middle or a little above middle.  It now has awesome sound compared to before!  Do this while using quality headphones or earbuds to really blow your head off with the difference.  If you switch back to SRS TruSurround you will lose all Bass and back to tin can sound.  Follow my instructions above to restore Bass and great sound!  Leave SRS TruSurround off and the sound will remain good with EQ and Bass settings functional.  You will notice it still has a decent surround effect.  Again this is a software bug in the firmware and its too bad Vizio won't fix this flaw on a rather excellent LED TV.  Note:  This audio fix only works when using HDMI ports.

Reviews.Content: This TV may have a great picture, but the audio quality was terrible. I is *really* tinny. It sounds like a cheap clock radio.It was really bad. I tried TV, DVD, and some of the Internet apps - all had the same lousy sound.It has a great picture, but that's useless if it sounds this bad. External sources like DVDs and cable might be salvaged by a home theatre sound system, but the Internet applications all have to TV which (have I mentioned this) sounds horrid.This TV was a huge disappointment, and I am returning it.
